description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said his phone call with U.S. President Donald Trump was “substantive” and the two agreed to further discussions on the two countries’ “broader economic and security partnership.” “The president respected Canada’s sovereignty today, both in his private and public comments,” Carney said on March 28 in Montreal. Speaking to reporters in […]
title: Carney Says Trump’ Respected Canada’s Sovereignty,’ Agreed to Negotiations During Call

description: Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe is heading to Germany and the UK on a trade mission to expand export opportunities. Moe’s trip comes as the United States is expanding its tariffs on Canadian imports. Saskatchewan has also been impacted by tariffs imposed by China on some Canadian agricultural products, including some canola products. The levies were […]
title: Saskatchewan Premier Travels to Germany, UK to Boost Trade Relations

description: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexey Overchuk says that Moscow would seek to balance its relationship between Washington and Beijing.
title: Russia Seeks to Balance Ties With US, China: Official

description: One rural birthing unit “teeters on the brink” and goes from “one disaster to the next” due to severe staff shortages. Another maternity service in a farming town of 15,000 closed four years after opening its doors, forcing specialists and medical workers out of town. Fly-in-fly-out locum doctors prop up two birthing units in a […]
title: Rural Birth Care ‘Crisis’ Looms Amid Staff Shortages

description: Counterintelligence spy chief James Angleton's testimony to the Church Committee was uncovered by The Epoch Times hours after declassification.
title: Long Hidden Spy Chief Testimony Uncovered in National Archives

description: Trump's senior adviser Elon Musk, who is from South Africa, posted on X last week that the song has been 'actively promoting white genocide.'

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.

description: Kyiv won’t treat U.S. aid as debt and is still assessing Washington’s latest minerals agreement proposal, the Ukrainian president says.

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is promising to hand life sentences to major traffickers, emphasizing his tough-on-crime approach in the electoral campaign. Individuals convicted of five or more counts of human trafficking would receive life sentences under a Tory government, Poilievre said while speaking on March 28 in Nanaimo, B.C. Those convicted of importing or exporting […]
title: Poilievre Promises Life Behind Bars for Traffickers of People, Guns, and Fentanyl

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney makes an announcement at 3:50 p.m. ET on March 28.
title: Canada’s Prime Minister Mark Carney Makes an Announcement

description: Hudson’s Bay says it has notified about 200 of its staff working in corporate roles that their employment will be terminated next week. Company spokesperson Tiffany Bourré says the move is a result of the restructuring process underway at the department store chain after it filed for creditor protection earlier in the month. Court documents […]
title: Hudson’s Bay Cuts 200 Corporate Jobs Effective April 4

description: A constitutional expert says Australia's federal system shares similarities with the US situation.

description: The new governing coalition includes four of the five political parties that won seats in Greenland's March 11 election.

description: Vancouver police say they are investigating 28 anti-Tesla incidents and will deploy more than 130 extra officers to “maintain order” at protests targeting the electric carmaker this weekend. The force says in a statement that the incidents targeting Tesla are suspected to be politically motivated and all have occurred since Jan. 20. It says 19 […]
title: Vancouver Police Deploying Big Presence to ‘Maintain Order’ at Anti-Tesla Protests

description: The vice president and second lady arrived at a U.S. base on the northwest coast of Greenland on Friday.
title: Vance and Wife Tour US Military Base in Greenland as Trump Admin Eyes Territory

description: Dave “Pik” Turmel, the country’s most wanted fugitive and the alleged head of the Blood Family Mafia (BFM) in Quebec, has been arrested in Italy, police say. The 29-year-old was taken into custody on March 27 by police in Rome, Italy, after being on the run for more than a year.  Turmel was arrested in […]
title: Canada’s Most Wanted Fugitive Arrested in Italy

description: Old Man Winter is proving to be a resilient cuss, slamming through parts of Canada with a wallop of heavy snow and freezing rain and turning roads into a smash-up derby. Mounties in Alberta say they’ve responded to 147 crashes so far and are urging drivers to keep their mirrors clear of snow and their […]
title: Snow, Freezing Rain Hitting Much of Canada Causing Crashes, Road Closures

description: Intelligence leaders face grilling over Signal chat leak; U.S. announces 25 percent auto tariffs; and top MS-13 gang member arrested.

description: HHS plans to cut a quarter of its workforce down to 62,000 employees.

description: Jessica Paige has a new vision for the future of food producers in America, whereby increasingly more people might build their own organic farm-to-table enterprise from the ground up and feed themselves and their community. Every week, the 26-year-old first-generation Illinois farmer fills up boxes of her own “beyond organic” produce—heirloom tomatoes, spinach, carrots, onions, […]
title: ‘Beyond Organic’: Illinois Woman Starts Farm-to-Table Regenerative Farm Based on Christian Faith

description: The air strike against a Hezbollah stronghold marked an escalation of Israel's attacks against the terrorist group near its border.

description: The Russian president renewed his argument that the current Ukrainian government is illegitimate and suggested Kyiv may renege on a peace deal.

description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he spoke with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney over the phone, and that the two leaders plan to meet “immediately” after the federal election.  “It was an extremely productive call, we agree on many things,” Trump said on Truth Social on March 28, adding that the two would meet “immediately […]
title: Trump Says Call With Carney ‘Extremely Productive,’ Says They Will Meet After Election

description: Commentary What does it take to subvert Canadian democracy? No grand conspiracies, misinformation bots, or foreign sleeper agents are required. All you really need are a couple of school buses. Consider the case of MP Han Dong. In 2019, several busloads of Chinese international students suddenly arrived at the federal Liberal nomination contest for the […]
title: What Does the US Have That Canada Needs? Open Primaries

description: The federal government posted a budgetary deficit of $26.8 billion for the April-to-January period of its 2024-25 fiscal year. The result compared with a deficit of $25.7 billion for the same period a year earlier. According to the Finance Department’s monthly fiscal monitor, revenue for the 10-month period totalled $398.6 billion, up from $359.3 billion […]
title: Ottawa Posts $26.8 Billion Deficit for April-to-January Period

description: Quebec Premier François Legault said he commends Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre on his stance allowing provinces more control on immigration, but unlike the 2021 election, he stopped short of endorsing a Tory leader for the election. Legault said in a press conference on March 27 his two priorities are “identity” and “prosperity,” while noting his […]
title: Quebec Premier Welcomes Poilievre’s Immigration Stance, Says He’s Not Endorsing Any Leaders This Time

description: One campaigner has criticised schools for using rewards to improve attendance, saying they isolate children who miss school through no fault of their own.
title: Influence of Lockdown, Pandemic-Era Messaging Contributing to Pupil Absences, Report Suggests

description: A team of researchers at the University of British Columbia want to make a stir stick drug testing tool for spiked drinks the norm in the hospitality industry, and they’re gearing up to start “real-world testing” in hopes of commercializing the idea. The device called “Spikeless” was developed in the university’s faculty of applied science, […]
title: UBC Scientists Invent Stir Stick That Detects Drugs in Drinks

description: The Russian leader also said he supported Western cooperation as oil, gas, and metal deposits are being developed in the region.

description: Statistics Canada says the Canadian economy was off to a solid start in January but early signs suggest growth hit a wall in February. description: For the second day in a row, Liberal Leader Mark Carney has been pulled away from campaigning to discuss U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs. description: Commentary In May 1844, George Brown was on a special trip to New York City to acquire the best technology he could afford—Toronto’s very first cylinder rotary printing press, a model developed by R. Hoe & Co.—for his latest venture. The 26-year-old Edinburgh-born political journalist had worked in Manhattan for five formative years writing and […]
title: George Brown: From Newspaper Entrepreneur to Father of Confederation (Part 1)

description: With the average household already spending £2,062 on essentials each month, the latest increases could add another £49.45 to this figure.

description: The rain has finally eased at Peter Batt’s property, but he isn’t going anywhere soon. “We are in heavy black soil country. description: Case involves the 1985 torture and killing of U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration agent Enrique 'Kiki' Camarena.

description: In recent years, Chinese cargo ships have been linked to multiple damaged underwater cables worldwide.

description: He walked free with a two-year community corrections order.

description: A group of Albertans, including two former MPs, is planning a delegation to Washington this year to gauge U.S. support for the province’s independence, which they say could lead to the possibility of joining the United States.
